name: places/ChIJv_suYoFYwokRSluv8GWeG1o
formattedAddress: 585 West End Ave # 1D, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 585 West End Ave # 1D, New York, NY 10024-1715, USA

originalText.text: Dr. Trautman is clear that he doesn't 'do therapy'.  He is a psychopharmacologist and only 'manages medications' which means:  he gets you in and out in under ten minutes;  he never requires medical tests or results; he  prescribes what you ask for but insists that you come every week so he can charge your insurance company ($300 a visit in my case).  He asked "How are you?" every week, I said "fine' and wrote him out a check for a co-pay.  He is huffy and sensitive and plays games with the phone and appointments.  He does the least amount of work- with the least amount of responsiveness or care- for the most amount of money of any medical professional I've ever encountered.  He has a sense of entitlement and superiority that is not uncommon in his profession.

He does the least amount of work- with the least amount of responsiveness or care- for the most amount of money of any medical professional I've ever encountered.  He has a sense of entitlement and superiority that is not uncommon in his profession.

originalText.text: Dr trautman is a purely psychopharmacology manager, he will work with your therapist if you have one but really all his job is is to check in and see how your medications are working and how things are going very generally. 15 minute appointments is the norm. He’s not a therapist so don’t expect him to provide therapy or delve into details of your life. After having been drained of tens of thousands of dollars over 5 years trying to treat an anxiety disorder with a very highly recommended psychiatrist who did therapy and going in for appointments up to 3 times per week, my anxiety only became worse to the point that I was barely functioning. On my first visit to dr trautman he prescribed me a low dose Paxil and boom, all my years of problems vanished. At his suggestion we meet once every few months, he doesn’t try to overbook me with needless appointments like my old doctor. I’m happier and more productive than I’ve ever been and I’m no longer spending thousands of dollars on therapy or being doped up on benzodiazepines. Yes he is not very talkative but if you need someone to figure out your medicines, especially if you’ve struggled for a long time with other doctors, i highly recommend dr trautman
